attributes.action: Keep the UK's membership of the EU Convention on Human Rights
attributes.additional_details: Leaving the EU Convention on Human Rights means the UK population could be open to threats of a return to the death penalty, torture, no right to assembly, and could lose many acquired rights such as paid maternity/paternity leave, paid holiday leave, maximum working hours, union membership, appeal against unfair dismissal, and many others.
attributes.background: We should remain within the ECHR to protect our legal rights.
